text: The 2005 New Year Honours in New Zealand were appointments by Elizabeth II in her right as Queen of New Zealand, on the advice of the New Zealand government, to various orders and honours to reward and highlight good works by New Zealanders, and to celebrate the passing of 2004 and the beginning of 2005. They were announced on 31 December 2004, and included gallantry awards for actions in East Timor. The recipients of honours are displayed here as they were styled before their new honour. ==Order of New Zealand (ONZ)== ;Ordinary member * The Right Honourable Jonathan Lucas Hunt – of Waitakere City; Speaker of the House of Representatives.
